citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
There is not currently an attending veterinarian overseeing the provision of adequate veterinary care. Visits are scheduled
monthly, but an attending veterinarian has not conducted a site visit since February 2022 and, according to the licensee,
is no longer available for or responsive to communications about animals at the facility. Veterinary care is being provided
for individual problems of animal health or wellbeing, but there isn't an attending veterinarian ensuring the provision of
adequate veterinary care or overseeing the adequacy of other aspects of animal care and use. An attending veterinarian
who provides adequate veterinary care according to this section of the AWA must be employed under formal
arrangements.
To be corrected by May 12th, 2023.

This facility did not have a contingency plan in place at the time of inspection. Exhibitors must develop, document, and
follow an appropriate plan to provide for the welfare of their animals in the event of an an emergency or disaster, review
the plan annually, and ensure personnel are trained regarding their roles and responsibilities as outlined in the plan.
After discussion of this item with the licensee at the time of inspection, a plan was developed and implemented. To remain
corrected after April 26th, 2023.
This inspection was conducted with a facility representative and the final exit briefing was conducted with the licensee.
